Based on the aforementioned data, guidance from AGA and expert advice suggests that daily doses of GCs >20 mg prednisolone equivalents for treatment durations >4 weeks should be considered as having at least moderate risk for HBVr and warrant antiviral prophylaxis in HBsAg positive patients.
17, 33 On the contrary, the risk is low in HBsAg negative/anti-HBc positive patients and monitoring, rather than prophylaxis treatment, is advised.
